rules: Rule1: Provided that the activist mobilizes the public, the activist influences the legislation.
Rule2: Either the activist mobilizes the public or the activist petitions the public.
Rule3: Whenever the activist petitions the public, the organization lobbies for the legislation.
Rule4: Under the condition that the senate passes the legislation, the legislation is beneficial for the environment.
Rule5: If the senate blocks the legislation, then the legislation is beneficial for the environment.
Rule6: In case the president overrides the senate, the legislation is enacted.
Rule7: Either the president overrides the senate or, alternatively, either the senate passes the legislation or the senate blocks the legislation.
Rule8: Provided that the congress overrides the veto, then if the president vetoes the legislation, it is not the case that the legislation is enacted.
Rule9: If the congress votes for the override, then the congress overrides the veto.
Rule10: Either the congress votes for the override or the congress votes against the override.
Rule11: Under the condition that the congress votes against the override, the congress overrides the veto.
Rule12: If the legislation regulates emissions, then the legislation is beneficial for the environment.
Rule13: Provided that the legislation subsidizes renewables, the legislation is beneficial for the environment.
Rule14: If the legislation addresses pollution, then the legislation targets the industry.
Rule15: Either the legislation addresses pollution or the legislation mitigates pollution.
Rule16: Whenever the legislation mitigates pollution, then either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables.
Rule17: Either the agency assesses the legislation or the agency reviews the legislation.
Rule18: Under the condition that the agency reviews the legislation, then if the legislation targets the industry, either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables.

Rule19: If the agency approves the legislation, then if it is not the case that if the agency assesses the legislation then if the legislation targets the industry, either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables, then the industry is compliant with the legislation.
Rule20: Either the agency approves the legislation or the agency rejects the legislation.
Rule21: If the activist introduces the legislation, then the activist proposes the legislation.
Rule22: Under the condition that the activist introduces the legislation, it is not the case that the legislation is debated in the committee.
Rule23: Either the activist introduces the legislation or, alternatively, either the public opposes the legislation or it is not the case that the public supports the legislation.
Rule24: If the lobbyist corrupts the process, then the lobbyist influences the senator.
Rule25: Whenever the lobbyist corrupts the process, it is not the case that the process delays the legislation.
Rule26: Either the lobbyist corrupts the process or the organization lobbies for the legislation.
Rule27: Under the condition that the lobbyist weakens the legislation, the process delays the legislation.
Rule28: Provided that the lobbyist influences the senator, the lobbyist weakens the legislation.
Rule29: If the media covers the event concerning the legislation, then the legislation is polarizing.
Rule30: Either the media covers the event concerning the legislation or the public protests at the event concerning the legislation.

Rule31: Under the condition that the public protests at the event concerning the legislation, then either the legislation is controversial or, if the legislation addresses pollution, then either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables.

Rule32: Provided that the firm litigates the legislation, then if the agency rejects the legislation, then if it is not the case that if the agency assesses the legislation then if the legislation targets the industry, either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables, then the industry is compliant with the legislation.

Rule33: If the firm arbitrates the legislation, then if the agency rejects the legislation, then if it is not the case that if the agency assesses the legislation then if the legislation targets the industry, either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables, then the industry is compliant with the legislation.
Rule34: Either the court challenges the legislation or the court upholds the legislation.
Rule35: Under the condition that the court upholds the legislation, then either the firm litigates the legislation or the firm arbitrates the legislation.
Rule36: In case the supreme court rules on the challenge, then if the court challenges the legislation, then either the firm litigates the legislation or the firm arbitrates the legislation.
Rule37: Provided that the legislation has strict standards, the legislation regulates emissions.
Rule38: Either the legislation has strict standards or the legislation has flexible standards.
Rule39: Under the condition that the legislation has flexible standards, the legislation has voluntary standards.
Rule40: If the NGO evaluates the legislation, then the NGO endorses the legislation.
Rule41: Either the NGO evaluates the legislation or the NGO monitors the legislation.
Rule42: Under the condition that the NGO monitors the legislation, then if the legislation has voluntary standards, the legislation subsidizes renewables.
Rule43: Provided that the NGO endorses the legislation, then if the legislation has voluntary standards, the legislation subsidizes renewables.
Rule44: If the activist proposes the legislation, then the legislation is amended by the committee.
Rule45: Under the condition that the legislation is amended by the committee, the legislation is debated in the committee.
Rule46: Either the organization funds the activist or the legislation is beneficial for the environment.
Rule47: Provided that the organization lobbies for the legislation, it is not the case that the organization funds the activist.

Rule48: Provided that it is not the case that if the agency assesses the legislation then if the legislation targets the industry, either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables, then it is not the case that the industry is compliant with the legislation.

Rule49: If it is not the case that if the agency rejects the legislation then if it is not the case that if the agency assesses the legislation then if the legislation targets the industry, either the legislation regulates emissions or the legislation subsidizes renewables, then the industry is compliant with the legislation, then the agency penalizes the industry.
Rule50: Under the condition that it is not the case that the legislation is beneficial for the environment, the public supports the legislation.
facts: Fact1: The president vetoes the legislation.
Fact2: The supreme court rules on the challenge.
Fact3: It is not the case that the public opposes the legislation.
Fact4: It is not the case that the agency penalizes the industry.
Fact5: It is not the case that the legislation is controversial.
Fact6: It is not the case that the legislation is polarizing.
Fact7: It is not the case that the activist influences the legislation.

question: The legislation is beneficial for the environment.
